comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: From Krakow, it seems. Want to do your own Krakoviak dance? Instructions here: www.yiddishdance.com/Krakoviak.pdf

comment.author: 44867875@N00
comment._content: In Polish, the spelling would be "krakowiak". The word also means "a male resident of Kraków". And, as if there were not enough confusion, a female resident of Kraków would be "krakowianka".

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Other Bain/LOC photos taken during the Midsummer Day Festival of the girls of Washington Irving High School, on June 23, 1911, in Bronx Park [corrected on some photos to Pelham Bay Park]: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163520196/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163519956/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163516194/#] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2162718041/in/photostream/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2162714589/in/photostream/] New York Times story, June 24, 1911 [scrolling required]: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9A02E1DA1E3EE2...
